Description: Steatite shabti with a curled lappet-wig(damaged at the front), a modelled face, a collar, elbow-length pleated sleeves and crossed arms with bracelets holding two hoes; the apron is inscribed with an epithet above a blank space for the personal name; around the back of the legs is inscribed part of Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead in three rows of Hieroglyphs; there is a pillar separating the feet and a plinth beneath them.
Condition: fair - damage to the front of the head
